CONPEDERATION.

Mr. Arman) wished to ask a question of the government in connection with the subject be- fore the House. He had seen a paragra h in the organ of the government, the Co om‘st, which he thought required an explanation.— The paragrap alluded to a certain meeting recentli held at Cornwall, known to be re re- sented y John Sandtleid Macdonald, a ‘ ate Premier of Canada; without further preface, he would read the following curious statement from the paper referred to:—

“ FBOM CANADA.—Comwall, Canada March 2.—At a public demonstration and dinner to the members of the Government last ni ht, speeches were made by Gait, Howland,‘ - donaid and Cartier. Macdonald asserted that

the Confederation of the Provinces was now certain to take place in a few weeks.”
